content.description: A short, awkward problem -- SDS on pocket on the left top of the boulder and the flake near the center. Traverse right and finish topping out above the mid-height nose on the right.
content.protection: It's so short, you don't really need anything, but bring a pad if you want.
content.location: Trailside of the small boulder just to the right of the trail.

content.description: Sit start in the shallow dihedral with the deep undercling and mantley push. Pull up and work into the obvious jug. Use high feet to get into it, and find hidden holds, to pull the top out. Down climb on the NE corner.
content.protection: Pads, spotter. This is a moderate highball with a top out not below the grade.
content.location: Find the main boulder of the area and look at the north face for the large, blocky hole. Sit start below this in the shallow dihedral.

content.description: A nice highball is the center-piece of these, with a few short boulders scattered nearby.
